SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc12
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model

Class Lobby

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Room
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Lobby
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Lobby extends Room implements Serializable
Represents a game lobby where players wait for new games to start.

This class extends the Room class and manages the list of players who have joined the lobby. It also handles the color management, showing their availability to the players and keeps track of the maximum number of players allowed in the lobby.

As an implementation of the Serializable interface, instances of this class can be serialized, allowing for network transmission of lobby information.

See Also:

      public void addPlayer(Player player) throws FullLobbyException

      Parameters:

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Player player)
      Removes a player from the lobby and makes the eventually selected color available again.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be removed from the lobby.

    • getMaxPlayers

      public int getMaxPlayers()
      Returns the maximum number of players allowed in this lobby.
      Returns:
      The maximum number of players for this lobby.

    • setMaxPlayers

      public void setMaxPlayers(int numOfMaxPlayers)
      Sets a new maximum number of players for this lobby. The maximum value cannot exceed 4.
      Parameters:
      numOfMaxPlayers - The new maximum number of players.

    • getAvailableColors

      public List<Color> getAvailableColors()
      Returns the list of colors which have not yet been selected by players in this lobby.
      Returns:
      The list of colors which have not yet been picked for this lobby.

    • assignColor

      public void assignColor(Player player, Color color) throws UnavailableColorException
      Assigns the selected color to the specified player, provided that it is available. If the player already has an assigned color, it is made available again.
      Parameters:
      player - The player which is requesting the color assignment.
      color - The color to be assigned to the player.
      Throws:
      UnavailableColorException - if the selected color is not available, or if it is black (reserved color for the starting player token).

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the lobby, including the maximum number of players, the list of players in this lobby and the list of currently available colors.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
